author: Dhruv Kulkarni
title: â€œTrophyless again this seasonâ€ â€“ Fans MOCK Tottenham Hotspur as Brighton secure dominant 4-2 victory
text:
Tottenham Hotspur started their season with a bang under new coach Ange Postecoglou. Despite losing Harry Kane to Bayern Munich, They topped the table but after a string of injuries and suspensions, there was a massive drop in form. From being at the top at Game Week 10, they dropped down to 4th.
Now they face
Brighton and Hove Albion at the AmEx Stadium. Looking to get back into the title race, Spurs aimed for a win. The hosts meanwhile needed to take a step closer to the top 6. With the two teams playing great football, many expected a good game to spectate, but it ended up being a one-sided affair.
Tottenham were completely dominated by the hosts, who slotted four goals past Guglielmo Vicario. The scoring was opened by Josh Hinshewood in the 11th minute. Just 13 minutes later, Dejan Kulusevski pulled Danny Welbeckâ€™s shirt in the box, which didnâ€™t allow him to take a shot. After consulting VAR, a penalty was awarded and Joao Pedro made it 2-0.
Pervis Estupinian scored a screamer from outside the box after a corner to put Brighton 3-0 up in the 63rd minute. 12 minutes later Giovani Lo Celso conceded another penalty, which Pedro once again converted. In the last 15 minutes it looked like Spurs mightâ€™ve equalized as they managed to score two goals. Alejo Veliz and Ben Devis scored in the 81st and 85th minute, but Spurs were unable to find the back of the net.
â€œBottle Job FC is Backâ€ â€“ Mesut Ozilâ€™s HILARIOUS tweet to banter Tottenham leaves internet in stitches
Fans banter Tottenham as they drop out of the top 4
With 4 goals conceded, Tottenham Hotspur were subjected to banter by fans. Many joked how they were going to go trophyless for the 15th season in a row, something the club was used to. Others criticized their poor performance, with captain Hueng-min Son being one of the players with a poor performance.
Check out some of the fansâ€™ reactions:
With this loss,
Spurs have dropped down to 5th. From being at the top, the team has collapsed due to injuries. Brighton on the other hand are now 8th, just a point behind Manchester United. Spurs will now play AFC Bournemouth, who have had a 7-game unbeaten run, while Brighton face West Ham.
In case you missed:
WATCH: Real Betis officially extends Iscoâ€™s contract with HILARIOUS Ali G video â€œComing for the Ballon dâ€™Orâ€ â€“ Fans react to Jude Bellinghamâ€™s yet another award as he is CROWNED the best U-20 player by IFFHS Syed Talib Haider

author: @nzherald
title: Live weather: Flooding, thunderstorm risk, Auckland, Northland, Coromandel under heavy rain watch - NZ Herald
text:
A swathe of weather watches and warnings in place tonight for north and west of New Zealand Music festival, sports cancelled as thunderstorms forecast Campers, hikers and drivers warned of flooded rivers and slips Brief respite on Saturday before weather packs in again for New Yearâ€™s Eve Almost a full day of rain is likely for parts of New Zealand today and tonight, with the upper North Island and the west of the South Island in for heavy rain through to tomorrow.
Hikers, campers and New Yearâ€™s Eve revellers are being warned to take care as thunderstorms, slips and flooding - including flooded rivers - are possible in the worst-hit areas.
A warm, moist northwesterly flow is bringing rain or showers to all parts of the country, with thunderstorms possible in northern and western parts of both islands and the Deep South.
Flood risk north of Auckland This afternoon MetService added heavy rain watches for Northland, Coromandel and Auckland , where rain has already been bucketing down since lunchtime. Those regions are now set for periods of heavy rain with possible thunderstorms.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. Rain levels could approach or even exceed warning criteria in localised areas, the forecaster warned. Downpours of 25-40mm per hour were possible.
Thunderstorms and â€œvery heavy, slow moving rainâ€ meant there was a risk of pockets of flooding around the Northland-Auckland boundary this afternoon, according to forecaster Weatherwatch.co.nz .
A music festival in northwest Auckland has been cancelled at the last minute as thunder and lightning approach. The Love Your Ways festival in KumeÅ«, featuring Basement Jaxx, was deemed â€œunsafe to proceedâ€ by the venue. All ticketholders would be refunded, the organisers said.
Numerous sports matches around the country have also been cancelled including across Taranaki which has been hammered by torrential rain today.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. Weather warnings, watches covering north and west of country MetService last night put weather watches and warnings in place from Waikato and Bay of Plenty down to Fiordland, with 100-160mm of rain possible in some warning areas.
The west of the South Island is bearing the brunt of the bad weather , along with Taranaki, which has been hit by torrential rain since this morning.
A heavy rain warning is in place for Taranaki Maunga through till 3am with a peak of 15-25 mm/h expected until mid-afternoon today.
The Westland ranges are under a 21-hour heavy rain warning until 6am Saturday, with 100-140 mm of rain expected over that time and peak rates of 20-30mm/h. Nelson has a heavy rain warning until 7pm tonight with up to 90mm of rain in total.
ðŸŒ§ï¸ðŸŸ  Severe Weather Warnings
Heavy rain continues to feed into the west of New Zealand today, along with the risk of thunderstorms.
Heavy rain warnings for the ranges of Westland, areas west of Motueka and Taranaki Maunga. pic.twitter.com/4ZvhdwEOkc
â€” MetService (@MetService) December 28, 2023 Heavy rain watches lasting 22 hours are in place for Buller, Waikato, Waitomo, Taumarunui, TaupÅ, Tongariro National Park and the Kaimanawa Mountains, while Fiordlandâ€™s watch lasts for 20 hours.
In the Bay of Plenty including Rotorua a heavy rain watch is in place till 10am Saturday.
Rainfall amounts could reach warning criteria in all those areas, with thunderstorms also possible in many areas.
Heavy rain means streams and rivers can rise rapidly and driving conditions may be hazardous, with possible surface flooding and slips. Thunderstorms are also possible in many areas, bringing intense localised downpours, according to MetService.
The national forecasterâ€™s meteorologist John Law said those thinking of going camping should keep an eye on the forecasts to avoid being stranded by sudden floods or slips.
With heavy rain also expected across the Tararua Ranges and the Tongariro Crossing, keen hikers should also take care, Law said.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. New Yearâ€™s Day to bring drier weather for 2024 The fast-moving weather system should improve by mid-Saturday but another front will bring more rain on Sunday, MetService says.
But thereâ€™s good news as 2024 dawns - both MetService and private forecaster WeatherWatch expect the weather to clear for New Yearâ€™s Day.
WeatherWatch head forecaster Philip Duncan said a big block of high pressure coming in from the Tasman Sea and Southern Ocean will bring clearing, cooler weather on January 1, with the recent high humidity taking a break.
ðŸ“ºâ›ºï¸ðŸ¥³Last weather #video of 2023: #NewZealand 10 day outlook as January 2024 arrives ... https://t.co/24z3vntqfH
â€” WeatherWatch.co.nz (@WeatherWatchNZ) December 28, 2023

author: NNPA
title: Birmingham Youth Choir Wows AGT Judges - Catch Them Live
text:
The Birmingham Youth & Young Adult Fellowship Choir earns Simon Cowellâ€™s Golden Buzzerâ€”now on stage Julyâ€¯20 in Birmingham.
By SPEAKINâ€™ OUT NEWS
Choir director Ahkeem Lee celebrates with the group after Simon Cowell hit the Golden Buzzer on AGT. BIRMINGHAM, Ala. â€” The Birmingham Youth & Young Adult Fellowship Choir has earned the hearts of Americaâ€™s Got Talent judges, receiving the coveted Golden Buzzer from Simon Cowell after a soul-stirring rendition of â€œJoyful, Joyful, Lord We Adore Thee.â€
â€œI could see and hear how much work went into this,â€ Cowell said before pressing the buzzer, adding, â€œEvery single one of you played the perfect partâ€¦ Iâ€™m so honored you came here on our 20th anniversaryâ€.
The 10-year-old choirâ€”founded in 2015 as a back-to-school fundraiserâ€”took their talents to Pasadena, California for the AGT auditions. Their choreographed rendition of the hymn, infused with emotional gospel energy, earned them a standing ovation from all judges.
Choir director Ahkeem Lee reflected on the moment:
â€œGoing on stage, I actually felt a sense of reliefâ€¦ Iâ€™ll never forget how blown away I was by the choirâ€™s performance that night.â€
The choirâ€™s local impact continues: their 10th Anniversary Celebration concert and benefit is scheduled for Sunday, July 20, at 3:30 p.m. at Sixteenth Street Baptist Church. Like their first concert, it aims to support local students by distributing free school supplies.
This is a rare opportunity to see the choir liveâ€”donâ€™t miss this inspiring homecoming performance!

organizations.name: Birmingham Youth & Young Adult Fellowship Choir

author: @andaluciainf
title: Muere un anciano y una mujer resulta herida grave en un accidente de coche en NÃ­jar | AndalucÃ­a InformaciÃ³n. Todas las noticias de AlmerÃ­a
text: Un hombre ha muerto y una mujer ha resultado herida de carÃ¡cter grave a causa de un accidente de trÃ¡fico registrado esta tarde en la carretera AL-3106 en NÃ­jar (AlmerÃ­a), segÃºn informa el servicio unificado de emergencias 112 de AndalucÃ­a. El siniestro se produjo sobre las 17.45 horas en la carretera AL-3106, en el municipio de NÃ­jar. Ambos ancianos viajaban en el mismo turismo que se saliÃ³ de la vÃ­a cuando circulaban por la carretera que va desde Las Hortichuelas a las Negras. Tras el aviso a 112 y la activaciÃ³n de los operativos, hasta el lugar se desplazaron servicios sanitarios, Guardia Civil de TrÃ¡fico, ProtecciÃ³n Civil de NÃ­jar y Mantenimiento de la VÃ­a. El hombre, de unos ochenta aÃ±os de edad, ha fallecido en el lugar del accidente mientras que a la mujer, tambiÃ©n de edad avanzada, consiguieron estabilizarla y trasladarla con vida al Hospital TorrecÃ¡rdenas. Se ha activado el protocolo judicial. EnvÃ­a tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Elisa Peralta
title: Sofia Ribeiro assume ano desafiante: "Triste, angustiada, inquieta"
text:
Sofia Ribeiro resolveu falar sobre a 'trend' das redes socias, onde as pessoas partilham fotos dos momentos felizes vividos este ano com a premissa: "Como vou ver triste se em 2024 eu...".
A atriz deixou a seguinte reflexÃ£o aos seguidores: "Como vou ser triste se fingimos ser felizes o ano todo? NÃ£o deveria ser mais assim?"
Ao longo do texto, a atriz refere: "Ã‰ possÃ­vel e saudÃ¡vel celebrar, mas tambÃ©m acolher a dor. Sentir tristeza no meio das conquistas nÃ£o invalida tudo de bom que aconteceu."
Sofia sentiu necessidade de dar o seu exemplo num longo desabafo: "Este ano foi para mim, um dos mais felizes e tambÃ©m um dos mais desafiadores. [...] Dores novas surgiram. [...] Viver a tristeza da mesma maneira que vivemos a alegria, Ã© um ato de coragem."
"Sou muito mais alegre do que triste, mas tambÃ©m sou feita dos meus fracassos, das minhas angÃºstias, anseios. [...] A vida real, quotidiana, nÃ£o Ã© na maioria do tempo feliz, ou Ã©? Estiveste triste? Eu estive. Tive dias triste, angustiada, inquieta", confessou a atriz.
"NÃ£o Ã© humano estar feliz o tempo todo, o ano todo. E aceitar isso Ã© libertador e, para mim, essa foi uma grande conquista deste ano", terminou.
Leia TambÃ©m: [Ruben Rua: "A Sofia foi a minha primeira namorada. Lidei mal com o fim"](https://www.noticiasaominuto.com/fama/2692837/ruben-rua-a-sofia-foi-a-minha-primeira-namorada-lidei-mal-com-o-fim)
Leia TambÃ©m: [Sofia Ribeiro assume: "Estou disponÃ­vel para o amor"](https://www.noticiasaominuto.com/fama/2677116/sofia-ribeiro-estou-disponivel-para-o-amor)
